intro: Lass cordifolia, commonly known as the heart-leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It belongs to the family Primulaceae and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves are usually broad and have a slightly waxy texture, while its flowers range in color from white to pale pink. Lass cordifolia is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
